body.description: Looking for an affordable keyboard and mouse combo for your workplace or home office? Try Verbatim’s Slimline Corded USB Keyboard and Mouse – with convenient plug-and-play USB connectivity, you can be up and working in minutes. The Slimline Corded Keyboard features low-profile keys and adjustable tilt legs for quiet, comfortable typing. The layout features a full numeric keypad and full-size function keys, all within a slim, efficient design that frees up space on your desktop. The included mouse provides smooth, precise tracking in a comfortable, contoured design for effortless navigation.• Advanced tactile keys with low-profile design for quiet, comfortable typing• Adjustable tilt legs for added comfort• Slim, efficient design• Numeric keypad and full-size function keys• Compact, ergonomically designed mouse with precise optical tracking• Simple, plug-and-play USB corded connection&bullet. br />Package Includes: Slimline Corded USB Keyboard, Corded USB Mouse

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and Efficient for My Raspberry Pi Setup
reviews.reviewText: I recently picked up the Verbatim Slimline Corded USB Keyboard to configure my Raspberry Pi, and I've been thoroughly impressed with its performance and value. This affordable keyboard provides a comfortable and efficient typing experience without breaking the bank.The sleek and sturdy design of the Slimline Corded USB Keyboard features low-profile keys and adjustable tilt legs, making typing both quiet and comfortable. I appreciate the full numeric keypad and full-size function keys, all within a slim design that saves precious desktop space.One of the key highlights of this keyboard is its convenient plug-and-play USB connectivity, which made it incredibly easy to set up and use with my Raspberry Pi. It's compatible with both Windows and Mac operating systems, making it a versatile choice for corporate or home office workspaces.The package includes the Slimline Corded USB Keyboard itself, and since using it, I've found it to be a reliable and efficient addition to my workspace. The keyboard has proven to be durable and responsive, and I'm thrilled with my decision to give it a try.It's an excellent choice for configuring and working with my Raspberry Pi. If you're looking for an affordable, comfortable, and efficient keyboard, I highly recommend giving this one a shot. It's been a fantastic addition to my setup, and I believe it would be a great fit for any workspace.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Keyboard, Great Price
reviews.reviewText: I have two desktop computers that are identical, bought at the same exact time, One is mine, and my boyfriend uses the other, We've had them now about 5 years replaced the mice a week ago, and decided to replace the keyboards mine worked fine, however my letters had been wearing off since like the second week of owning it. HIs on the other hand I hated if I had to touch the keyboard all the keys stuck, you'd spend longer trying to get a key to work than what it would take to type out an actual sentence on a working keyboard. The keyboards I replaced were low profile keys, they were flat, supposed to help keep crumbs and such from getting under them. But I wanted to go back to "Old school" keyboards ones I knew held up well to his computer game playing, and mad at people online on a game typing (throwing the keyboard down, typing hard etc etc.) Plus I just missed the big chunky keyboard feel.I saw this keyboard for around $9.99 and got two, I am very pleased with it, I will have to get used to the backspace key being small again and the enter key being huge, but that's how I remember it being on the chunky key keyboards it's just been ages since I used one.Even though it is a chunky key type keyboard it is not loud there is no mechanical clinking and clanking when I type, Really all I hear is a light clicking and it doesn't annoy me at al;, where as back in the day the loud clanking kind did. This is a regular sized keyboard, it has the Power/sleep/wake keys on it, has the led light above the keypad for when you have cap locks/num locks and or scroll lock on. There are no volume keys for sound, which I am okay with I have no problem using my mouse to turn my volume up on my taskbar, and honestly my last keyboard had it and it annoyed me very much, I'd go to hit my print screen button and hit volume up instead.The keyboard over all feels durable yet light weight, it has the "feet" on the underside to prop it up a bit so you're not using it flat as a pancake, which can cause pain in your hands and wrist.I wish the plug was a bit longer, but other than that I'm thrilled with the entire keyboard, and the cord is just a minor issue I'm used to a super long cord - probably way too long for a keyboard to be honest -If you're in need of a decent no fill basic keyboard , this will work for you. and the price isn't bad either!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars works as expected, easy to install
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a replacement for my father's desktop computer after his last one went out on him. He's been using it for about a year now without issue and has no complaints. It was easy to plug it in and have the computer recognize it, a very straightforward installation. My only personal issue with the keyboard is that I found the backspace key unpleasantly small to use and constantly found myself hitting the incorrect key whenever I use his computer, which may also be a challenge for others.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The price was right for the project I was working with, a raspberry pi 3b+ no problem, basically I got what I paid for. Nothing fancy but it is pretty sturdy and should last
Perfect. Compact, stylish and quiet. The mouse is particularly comfortable and precise. Great value for money, although you need to buy batteries separately.
Basic layout but works well.The keyboard uses single AAA battery which needs to be replaced after about 1 month

The full-size layout of the keyboard ensures a comfortable typing experience, allowing me to type for extended periods without discomfort. The keys are responsive and have a satisfying tactile feedback, making every keystroke efficient and accurate.The slimline design is not only visually appealing but also saves valuable desk space. Its compactness doesn't compromise the usability of the keyboard, and the black color adds a touch of elegance to my workspace.The USB plug-and-play functionality simplifies the setup process. I appreciate that there's no need for additional drivers or software – I can simply connect the keyboard and start typing.The durability of the Verbatim Slimline Keyboard is impressive. The construction feels solid and sturdy, promising longevity even with regular use.

This keyboard is great; many of the new ones don't have LED indicators and you have to open a separate document to find out if you have the caps locked on the Num turned off (especially if you're typing a password) but not this one, there is a small light for all these functions and it is noticeable but small so that it does not take much from the battery.Excellent product all around.
Me gustó mucho el tamaño y el peso de este teclado...
